New Records: Georgia secured their first point at the European Championship after a penalty decision.
Georgia's goalkeeper made 11 saves, a standout performance.
Key Match Events: Patrik Schick scored an equalizer with a chested finish after a header rebound.
Georgia had a penalty awarded due to VAR after a handball decision.
Saba Lobzhanidze missed a late chance to win the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Czech Republic head coach Ivan Hasek expected a wild game.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia's manager Willy Sagnol expressed disappointment but pride in the team's effort.
Czech Republic manager Ivan Hasek acknowledged the match's intensity despite few goals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the final day of three consecutive matches in the competition.
The match was high-pressure with many critical moments.
